data.description: Join Triumph!At Triumph, our vision is a world where freight transactions are accurate and seamless on the most modern and secure freight transaction network. That’s why we’re looking for passionate, innovative, solutions-oriented people to join our team. We thrive on providing exceptional customer service and we look for team members with an entrepreneurial spirit and a passion to build successful partnerships with our clients. Because at the end of the day our goal is to help our partners businesses run better.Position Summary: This role is designed for current college students, particularly rising seniors, who are interested in building a career in Data Analytics and/or Data Science. The Summer Data Analyst Intern will gain hands-on experience supporting product strategy, customer success, and business intelligence initiatives by assisting with data analysis, reporting, and insight generation.The internship offers exposure to real-world datasets and cross-functional collaboration with teams including Customer Success, Product, and Data & Analytics. Interns will develop practical analytics skills while learning how data informs customer outcomes and strategic business decisions.Essential Duties & ResponsibilitiesSupport senior Data Analyst by assisting with historical data analysis, basic data scrubbing, mapping, and validation.Analyze user behavior, product performance, and operational data under the guidance of senior analysts.Support the review and interpretation of early machine-learning model outputs and help prepare materials for internal or customer-facing presentations.Conduct competitor, industry, and market research to support product and strategic planning.Participate in discussions with business stakeholders to help document requirements and prototype new analytic ideas.Assist with small-scale feature analysis or process improvement initiatives.Collaborate with data and analytics team members to support data quality checks and documentation efforts.Develop foundational knowledge in transportation data and related business domains.Education & ExperienceCurrently pursuing a Bachelor’s degree in Business, Computer Science, Data Analytics, Statistics, or a related field.Prior internship, academic projects, or coursework related to data analysis, analytics, or business intelligence is a plus.Interest in working collaboratively with cross-functional teams.Skills & Abilities RequiredBasic to intermediate knowledge of SQL and relational databases (or coursework covering these topics).Exposure to BI or data visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or Looker (academic or personal projects acceptable).Working knowledge of Microsoft Excel, including formulas and pivot tables.Foundational understanding of data analysis concepts and metrics.Curiosity and a strong analytical mindset with a willingness to learn new tools and techniques.Strong attention to detail and organizational skills.Clear communication skills, with the ability to explain analyses to technical and non-technical audiences.Ability to work effectively as part of a team and take direction from mentors.Exposure to Python, data pipelines, ETL concepts, or Agile methodologies is a plus but not required.Non-Negotiable Logistic Requirements:Must be currently pursuing an undergraduate or master’s degree in Marketing, Business Administration, or a related field, with an expected graduation date between December 2026 and August 2027Must be able to work onsite five days per week at our Dallas headquarters; housing assistance is not providedCompensation for this role is $24 per hour.Must be legally authorized to work in the United States for the full duration of the internship without current or future employer sponsorshipProgram dates: June 8 through August 7#LI-MFWe offer Medical, Dental, Vision, Paid Time Off, 401k and much more.Go on.  Do it.  Apply Today!
requirements: Participate in discussions with business stakeholders to help document requirements and prototype new analytic ideas.
Currently pursuing a Bachelor’s degree in Business, Computer Science, Data Analytics, Statistics, or a related field.
Exposure to Python, data pipelines, ETL concepts, or Agile methodologies is a plus but not required.
Must be currently pursuing an undergraduate or master’s degree in Marketing, Business Administration, or a related field, with an expected graduation date between December 2026 and August 2027
responsibilities: Collaborate with data and analytics team members to support data quality checks and documentation efforts.
Develop foundational knowledge in transportation data and related business domains.
Curiosity and a strong analytical mindset with a willingness to learn new tools and techniques.
